author: Staff Reporter
text:
The award for ‘Best Tamil Scholar-2016’ was given to A. Arivunambi of Pondicherry Central University by the Indian Medical Association, Tiruchi branch.

Every year, the association selects a scholar for ‘Best Tamil Scholar’ award. The organising committee of the association analysed the contributions of Tamil professors and selected Arivunambi , according to W. Justine, secretary of the association.

The award distribution function will be held in Tiruchi shortly.

In another development, T. Shanmuganantham, ME., Ph.D., assistant professor, Department of Electronics Engineering, Pondicherry University, has been elected International Fellow of ATMS by Antenna Test Measurement Society (ATMS), India.

According to a release, Mr. Shanmuganantham was recognised by the ATMS for his contributions to antenna engineering education and research. “His dedication and commitment to education and research had inspired a generation of antenna engineers, and he has been an author of several publications and research guide for many researchers,” the release said.

The ATMS Grade of Fellow is conferred by the ATMS Board of Directors upon a person with an outstanding record of accomplishments.
title: Professor honoured
